availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip Mains (Bracken County, Kentucky, day laborer and soldier)

body.p:
Bracken County, Kentucky, day laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Evaline McClanahan Mains in Bracken County on July 11, 1846. Father of James P. Mains, Benjamin Mains, Usley M. Mains, Philip S. Mains, William P. Mains, Harriett Mains. Day laborer in Bracken County in 1860. Served in the 16th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.)
as a Private from December 19, 1861, to October 24, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, District 1, p. 175.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bracken County Marriages, Film #000344097, p. 190 of 403 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 932.
